snippet: Mr. Tirole, a French economist, has provided insight into how governments can best tame powerful firms, the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences said.
abstract: French economist Jean Tirole, who has spent decades dissecting imperfect markets, wins Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Science; Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences says he has provided insight into how governments can best tame powerful firms and crack down on harmful monopolies.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Tirole, a French economist, has provided insight into how governments can best tame powerful firms, the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences said.

headline.main: Jean Tirole Wins Nobel in Economics for Work on Regulation
headline.print_headline: Economics Nobel for Work on Regulating Business
